document_title: Blocked vas deferens: Causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Blocked vas deferens is a disease that directly affects male fertility, and is one of the causes of male infertility. The disease occurs when the sperm duct becomes blocked at a certain location along the length of the vas deferens. (first)
The vas deferens in adults have a length of about 30 - 35 cm and an outer diameter of about 1.5 - 2 mm, with a lumen of 0.3 - 0.5 mm, with the function of leading sperm out for internal ejaculation. fertilization.
